Utterance: <synch>
Hi there! I’m so glad to see you again. How has the past week been for you?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been pretty hectic but good. The wedding is just around the corner.
How exciting! How are you feeling about it as the day approaches?
I’m feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. I want everything to go smoothly, but I know I can’t control everything.
That’s a very realistic perspective. Have you been able to implement the strategies we discussed in our last sessions?
Yes, I’ve been using the breathing exercises and journaling a lot. It really helps me stay calm.
I’m so glad to hear that! How has journaling been for you this past week?
It’s been great. I’ve been writing about my feelings leading up to the wedding and reflecting on my experiences in the PhD program.
That sounds like a productive way to process your emotions. Have you noticed any patterns in your writing?
I think I’m realizing that my anxiety often comes from wanting to please everyone, and that’s not realistic.

That’s an important insight. It’s natural to want to please others, but it’s essential to prioritize your own feelings as well. How can you remind yourself to focus on your happiness during the wedding?
I think I need to keep reminding myself that it’s my day, and I should enjoy it. I also want to take moments to step back and breathe.
That sounds like a solid plan. Creating those moments for yourself can help you stay grounded. Have you thought about how you’ll celebrate your own happiness on that day?
I want to take a few moments alone with my partner to soak it all in. I think that will help.
Absolutely! Those moments can be beautiful and grounding. How has your partner been feeling about the wedding?
He’s really excited too! We’ve been working together on the planning, which has been nice.
That’s great to hear! Having that support can help ease some of the stress. Have you both discussed how you’ll handle any potential family conflicts?
We have! We talked about staying united and focusing on each other, no matter what happens with family.
That’s a strong approach. It’s essential to present a united front. How do you feel about that plan?
I feel more confident. It’s nice to know we’re on the same page.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re both preparing well for the day. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I want to explore how I can balance my PhD work with wedding planning after the wedding.
That’s a great topic! Balancing multiple responsibilities can be challenging. What are your initial thoughts on how to manage both?
I think I need to set clear boundaries for my time. I don’t want to let one overshadow the other.
Setting boundaries is key. How might you structure your time to ensure you’re dedicating attention to both areas?
I could create a weekly schedule where I allocate time for PhD work and wedding-related tasks, so I’m not overwhelmed.
That sounds like a solid plan! Would you like to brainstorm what that schedule might look like?
Sure! I think I’d like to dedicate certain days to focus on my PhD readings and assignments, and then have specific days for wedding tasks.
That’s a great start! How does that feel to think about having a structured approach?
It feels relieving. I think having a plan will help me feel less scattered.
Absolutely! It’s all about finding that balance. You’re doing an amazing job navigating these changes. Is there anything else on your mind?
No, I think I’m good for today. I feel more prepared and focused.
I’m so glad to hear that! Remember, you have the tools to manage your anxiety and find joy in this process. Let’s check in again soon. Take care!
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate it.
Goodbye!
Goodbye!
